root.title: Uyk-Arjan (е-2)
root.place: The stone was erected in modern boundary Kokton in 2 km from the left coast of the river Uyk and in 1 km from an imperial barrow of Scythian time Arjan.
root.store: In 1916 г A.V.Andrianov has organized moving the monument to Minusinsk museum. Inv. #21.
root.general: The deer stone is a component of a small barrow in Arjan. It belongs to early nomads epoch of bronze. (VII-VI BC).
root.description: It is made from grey green fine slate. There are three lines, a circle, weapons and signs on the top part of a stone. Old Turkic epitaph is put by 2 lines from below upwards. There are images of small sign kind of a half moon and a poker on underside.
root.size: Height - 2,40 m, length - 0,49 m, width - 0,29 m.
root.investigation: The monument has been found by I.R.Aspelin in 1888. It was investigated by J.G. Granö in 1906.
root.details: Н.Базылхан "Көне түрік бітіктастары мен ескерткіштері (Орхон, Ениесей, Талас)" //"Қазақстан тарихы түркі тілді деректемелерде" атты сериясы бойынша. II том. - Алматы: Дайк-пресс, 2005. - Б.171.
